fields.description:
When opening/closing repository groups the repository icons fail to update the positon when staying in the view and this cause the icons to stack on top of each other (screenshot attached)

Icons are corrected when changing the active view from the sourcetree panel to some other window.
fields.summary: Repository group icon position not updated when opening/closing a group

fields.description:
*+Reproduce Step:*
 # expand / collapse more than 2 groups

*+Actual Result:*
 # repository image position error
fields.summary: UI error (repository image position error) when repositoryGroup expand / collapse

fields.description: When creating a stash if I select the option "Keep stashed changes" it doesn't keep the changes. I have the latest version.
fields.summary: Stash -> Keep stashed changes is not working

fields.description:
I have some custom commands to update my local branches to match remote branches.  The commands are configured as follows:

Script to run: /usr/local/bin/git
parameters: checkout -B master origin/master

These worked until a relatively recent version of SourceTree.  Now they fail with this strange error:
{code}git checkout -B master origin/master 
error: option `porcelain' takes no value
usage: git status [<options>] [--] <pathspec>...

    -v, --verbose         be verbose
    -s, --short           show status concisely
    -b, --branch          show branch information
    --porcelain           machine-readable output
    --long                show status in long format (default)
    -z, --null            terminate entries with NUL
    -u, --untracked-files[=<mode>]
                          show untracked files, optional modes: all, normal, no. (Default: all)
    --ignored             show ignored files
    --ignore-submodules[=<when>]
                          ignore changes to submodules, optional when: all, dirty, untracked. (Default: all)
    --column[=<style>]    list untracked files in columns

fatal: 'git status --porcelain=2' failed in submodule libs/external
Completed with errors, see above{code}

I have a workaround of running these commands on the command-line myself, but it was nice when they worked in SourceTree.

Even better would be if I could double-click origin/master in the history and update my local master branch to that commit (no matter what branch I am currently on).
fields.summary: Custom actions stopped working due to "error: option `porcelain' takes no value"

fields.description: When I've changed many .png files and I want to multiple select them at "File status" I'm using "Shift"+ mouse click to select about 100files - SourceTree just freezes. Sometimes crashed. And what going on actually - it's trying to generate preview Side-by-side - Before-> After on my images. Png files not really big in size, but it's just too much of them, but anyway SourceTree don't understand that and trying to open all of them.
fields.summary: Multiple selection of changed images cause freezing

fields.description:
In the list of commits, when I have enough branches or tags on a commit that the commit message is no longer visible (in and of itself something that shouldn't happen), it is not readily obvious whether there are more branch names following the four or so I can see.

Would be great if you could
 # shorten common branch prefixes (e.g. feature/xxx could become f/xxx or so) when space gets tight
 # show a branch "capsule" containing "..." as the last visible one if they don't all fit.
 # If the commit message would no longer be visible (or at least its beginning), show fewer branches, or even just the "..." capsule
 # Support hovering the mouse over a branch capsule to expand it to its full name if shortened
 # Support hovering the mouse over the "..." branch capsule to show all branch capsules (maybe in multiple rows as a temporary, transparent window, not unlike expansion tooltips)
fields.summary: Not obvious when branch list is clipped

fields.description:
Had this issue for a little while, probably since 2.5.x of the app. If I go to "Show Remote Hosted Repositories", I am presented with the error as shown in the screenshot. I get the error even if I don't have an account added in SourceTree!

Thing is, I can see my remote repositories okay as when I have an account present, I can double tap on it in this window to get the "clone a repository" popover, entering the correct Source URL. So SourceTree can go via the URL and grab the repository. It just refuses to show me the valid ones I can clone in the window, instead presenting this very odd error.

Host is a Bitbucket Server, Auth Type Basic, via HTTPS protocol.
fields.summary: Refreshing Remote Repositories Failed with "null" error

fields.description:
I have my Github account configured in SourceTree via SSH.

I have a project with several submodules and every single time that I try to checkout new branches/pull/push submodules I have authentication errors.

I'm prompted with the authentication window attached and tried inputting both my github username and email with both a generated Github's personal access token and with my SSH public key and I always have errors!

I have to fallback and do it via terminal but that's really a pain and a break in my workflow  !/images/icons/emoticons/sad.png!

One example of an error log that I can get from source tree's output when trying to checkout a new branch with changes in a submodule commit pointer is:
{noformat}
git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false -c credential.helper=sourcetree submodule update --init --recursive 2017-08-10 
12:18:11.670 SourceTreeLogin[79466:15546243] Encryption password is nil. Cannot save. User cancelled password prompt.Permission denied (publickey). fatal: Could not read from remote repository. 
Please make sure you have the correct access rights and the repository exists. Unable to fetch in submodule path '(...)'
{noformat}
 

I believe that, if the SSH account is configured in SourceTree, that should be propagated to every action that I do within it, doesn't matter if it's in a "main module", submodule, whatever.
fields.summary: Submodules can't be interacted with because user/password can't be retrieved

fields.description: When changing files and later switching back to Sourcetree and going to "filestatus", the changed files don't show up. Have to change the filter settings in order for the files to show up (switching to another filter and back to the one that was active before). Please check the video.
fields.summary: Not updating changed files

fields.description:
*Steps To Reproduce:*

1) Open A SourceTree Repository in Full Screen Mode

2) File -> Open Recent -> Choose Repository

 

*Notes:*
 * This was a feature I used in all versions previous to 2.6 w/ no issues
 * Video for reference: https://cl.ly/171g1L3r151x
fields.summary: SourceTree Crashes When Opening A Recent Repository In Full Screen Mode

fields.description:
Previously staged changes are showing up in my "Unstaged files" list. I can see the exact same changes if I click on the same file in the "Staged file list". In the attached screenshots, you can see the same change listed in the staged version of the file as is in the unstated version of the file.

This may have been introduced in 2.6.
fields.summary: Split View Staging does not work properly after recent update

fields.description:
I'm unable to enable GPG signing in Repository Settings, the Security tab is always disabled. GPGTools is installed, and "GPG Program" is set to "/usr/local/MacGPG2/bin" in preferences. I'm able to sign commits normally from the command line.

If there are any further requirements or errors for enabling GPG signing, SourceTree should provide some explanation instead of silently denying the repository security options.
fields.summary: GPG signing is still disabled after configuring GPG Program, with no explanation.

fields.description: On repository browser, title bar buttons are initially positioned incorrectly, then corrected on mouse up after dragging the window. Screen capture of issue is attached.
fields.summary: Repository browser: title bar buttons position glitch

fields.description: It's simple: the vertical scrolbars are not visible in dark theme. I can grab them, so I think the bar has the same color as the scroll background.
fields.summary: Scrollbars in dark mode are not visible

fields.description: It would be great to have a context menu item that deletes all the stashes, basically executes the {{git stash clear}} command.
fields.summary: "Delete all stashes" context menu

fields.description:
To reproduce:
 # Open a Git project that's up to date with the local repo (i.e. no pending files).
 # Add two files with an unknown (to Git) extension, e.g. {{foo.qqq}} and {{bar.qqq}}.
 # In the sidebar, the number "2" correctly appears against the "File status" item to indicate two new or modified files.
 # Right-click on one of the files, and add the pattern {{*.qqq}} to the *global* ignore list.
 # The files correctly disappear from the pending files view, however the file count in the sidebar remains at "2", even if you close and reopen the project.

The workaround is to close and reopen ST, at which point it correctly shows no pending file count against the "File status" sidebar item.

QA note: I didn't test adding the above pattern to the project's own {{.gitignore}} file, better check it works in that scenario too.
fields.summary: Modified file count includes those recently added to global ignore

fields.description:
On Mac OS. After downloading SourceTree license file the page says:

_"Within SourceTree select from the menu bar "SourceTree > Registration", click "Import License" to import the downloaded the license file."_

*There is no menu item for Registraion under SourceTree in the menu bar.*
fields.summary: No "Registration" or "Import License" in menu bar
Right click on a branch and select "Create pull request..." does nothing. I have to go on Repository -> Create pull request...

fields.description:
It seems as though GitHub has updated their links to use x-github-client instead of github-mac, and therefore sourcetree isn't opening them.

Ideally this would work again
fields.summary: Github desktop links (x-github-client) don't open in sourcetree
Rebasing error dialog

fields.description:
I am trying to make a first commit, but keep getting this error about logging in. I have reset my password multiple times, reinstalled SourceTree and nothing helps.

 

git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false -c credential.helper=sourcetree fetch origin

 

 

git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false -c credential.helper=sourcetree pull origin master

remote: Invalid username or password. If you log in via a third party service you must ensure you have an account password set in your account profile.

fatal: Authentication failed for 'https://jamttj@bitbucket.org/yodega/yodega-master.git/'

From https://bitbucket.org/yodega/yodega-master

* branch            master     -> FETCH_HEAD

fatal: refusing to merge unrelated histories

Completed with errors, see above
fields.summary: Authentication Errors

fields.description:
ST in Dark Mode

Commit Git changes with main ST window open as well as repo window.  After commit File Status in repo window stays with the previous number of files in the bubble and the main ST window also shows the same number in the bubble.  If I click on the man ST window to bring it back to focus, then the repo bubble number goes away.  When I click back to my repo window the File Status bubble goes away.
fields.summary: File Status Count Not Refreshing Unless Window Is Clicked
Crash when trying to open submodule in full screen

fields.description: In English, it's 'Show in Finder', and it should be '在 Finder 中显示' in Chinese, but the word '示' just shows half of it.
fields.summary: File status GUI error in Chinese language

fields.description:
In English, it's 'Show in Finder', and it should be '在 Finder 中显示' in Chinese, but the word '示' just shows half of it. 

There is an error to upload the screenshot, so you can change the language to Chinese which is '中文' to check it.
fields.summary: File status GUI error in Chinese language

fields.description:
It would be nice if the actions of a hunk in the file changes pane, stayed at the top as you scroll. Kind of sticky positioning, as in CSS3.

Sometimes when you have large files with many changed hunks, you have to scroll back and forth to select lines or hunks, and it's easy to miss the actions of the hunk in which you selected the lines. Then you must search again for the start of the hunk, can be a bit frustrated at times.
fields.summary: Sticky positioning changes pane actions

fields.description:
Sometimes, the thumb in the sidebar scroll bar is rendered to far to the right. It cuts the thumb in half vertically.

Not able to reproduce consistently.
fields.summary: Sidebar thumb misplaced

fields.description:
The image below is the newly installed SourceTree in Dark theme. The scroll bar on the right hand side is missing it's thumb.

!image-2017-08-02-15-46-59-501.png!
fields.summary: Thumb not visible when using Dark Theme
Cloning repository using url does not create .git/hooks directory

fields.description: In Preferences > Accounts, the avatars have a surprising low-res / poorly antialiased border
fields.summary: Rough border on account avatars in accounts list

fields.description: When selected, blue commits blend into the selection highlight
fields.summary: Blue commits hard to see when selected

fields.description:
In use for Game Development ( like Unity ), a lot of files are shown in working tree.
Most of them are unrelated changes which temporary changes.

And we are so difficult to find a specific folder or files we want to commit.

I usually use terminal and filtering with grep command, but we're so happy if SourceTree could filter files with filename or its path.
fields.summary: Filter working tree files

fields.description: Please add support for Mercurial's HistEdit extension.
fields.summary: Support for Mercurial's HISTEDIT extension
Main repo name in submodule repo header (like MainRepo/SubModuleRepo)

fields.description:
SourceTree for macOS is affected by vulnerabilities found in the Git and Mercurial software. This vulnerability can be triggered through a malicious repository when it is checked out using SourceTree. From version 1.4.0 of SourceTree for macOS this vulnerability can be triggered from a webpage through the use of the SourceTree URI handler.

*Affected versions:*
* Versions of SourceTree for macOS starting with 1.0b2 before version 2.6.1 are affected by this vulnerability.

*Fix:*
* Upgrade SourceTree for macOS to version 2.6.1 or higher from https://www.sourcetreeapp.com/

 
For additional details see [the full advisory|https://confluence.atlassian.com/x/c-mdNw].
fields.summary: Remote Code Execution via Git and Mercurial - (CVE-2017-1000117, CVE-2017-1000115, CVE-2017-1000116)

fields.summary: SourceTree Crashes When Trying to Open new Repo

fields.description:
It's really hard to read the text of what view you are selected on sometimes. Sometimes it works perfect other times it looks like the text below.

 

!Screen Shot 2017-07-28 at 4.07.10 PM.png!
fields.summary: Text Color Hard to Read

fields.description:
On our team of designers, we commit our Sketch design files to github.

Because these files can get large, I activated GIT LFS for our repo.

Now that LFS is active, I can no longer do this...

Right-click on file and select _Log Selected_ > Window opens to show file history > Right-click on previous commit and select _Open Selected Version._

I believe "Open Selected Version_"_ is trying to open the pointer reference in Sketch rather than the actual Sketch file the pointer is pointing to.
fields.summary: With GIT LFS activated, I can't "open selected version" anymore

fields.description:
h3. Summary 

In Mac OS 10.12.6, when trying to open a second repository in a new tab, SourceTree crashes. This only happens when the first repository is in fullscreen mode.  When not in fullscreen mode, the second repository opens in a new window, instead of in a new tab. The ability to open new tabs instead of new windows was introduced in the latest Mac OS ([How to use tabs in Mac OS Sierra|http://www.macworld.com/article/3088342/macs/how-to-use-tabs-in-macos-sierra.html] ).

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Open a repository in SourceTree and make it full screen

# On the top bar, go to File > Open recent and select another repository

# SourceTree will crash

Note: when not in full screen mode, the new repositories will open in new windows as normal.
fields.summary: Source Tree 2.6 crashes when opening repository in new tab

fields.description:
Steps:
 # Open a repository in SourceTree 2.6 for Mac.
 # Click the green full screen button in the window (if not already full screen).
 # Open another repository.
 # SourceTree crashes. Didn't crash in previous version.
fields.summary: Crashes when opening a repository when in Full screen mode

fields.description: I customized the toolbar, in one of the previous versions and added some Icons to it. After updating to the latest Source Tree version some Icons are removed from the toolbar (e.g. "GIT Flow", "Refresh", ... Icon). For me it looks like the toolbar has been reset to the default settings.
fields.summary: Icons removed from Toolbar after Update

fields.description:
I have setup Sourcetree using Bitbucket oauth and using SSH. 

When I Push it just says that I don't have permission. 

On same machine it works fine using Xcode.  

Sourcetree has never worked properly since it was migrated to Atlassian accounts- please can you kindly test this simple use case for getting your tool to use your own platform. ( or improve instructions for user to get Source tree working) 

GitKraken seems to work a lot better right now - when you guys used to have the best tools for developers. 

 

Expected behaviour
 # When I authorize with oauth  and bitbucket- I should be able to push to the repository in bitbucket or I should be given instructions if there are more things to do ..

 

Current Behaviour

When Pushing I get the following error: 

 
{code:java}
Permission denied (publickey).
fatal: Could not read from remote repository.
 
Please make sure you have the correct access rights
and the repository exists.
 
{code}
 When I try with Xcode to push to git using the same repos and same computer it works fine.  

When I try with Gitkraken on same machine using same repos it works fine.
fields.summary: Source Tree doesn't work with Bitbucket even on latest version

fields.description:
SourceTree crashes every time I attempt to open a new repo whilst running in fullscreen mode.

1. Be in fullscreen mode with a repo visible
2. Bring up Repo selector (CMD+0)
3. Double-click another repo
Observe crash.

Expected outcome: A new tab added to the window with the selected repo
fields.summary: Crash when opening repo in fullscreen mode

fields.description:
Using SourceTree for Mac version 2.6 (123), after I commit & push a change, the top-bar Push icon shows that there are commits that need to be pushed. Even after I delete the relevant local branch, pending pushes still appear in the Push icon. 

The pending pushes disappear after a few (3-4) minutes. It might be due to slow sync with the Bitbucket !https://jira.atlassian.com/images/icons/emoticons/help_16.png|width=16,height=16! , though there was no noticeable delay when I was pushing commits to BitBucket.
fields.summary: Pending push icon appears even though commits have been pushed to remote

fields.description:
I made some custom commands that I made by combining git command outside SourceTree and registered in custom action.
For that reason I am updating everything with SourceTree every time.
I would be very useful if there is a check option "Refresh after execution" in the custom action. Please consider it.
fields.summary: I want to auto refresh option after execute custom action

fields.description:
I've been a long time user of Source tree. And often used it to stage and unstage files from working directory. 

I've recently reinstalled my OS and all my software, and now I find that I can't use sourcetree to stage or unstage files. The checkboxes for file staged and unstaged in source tree seem to do nothing. They don't seem to reflect what is actually staged in the index in git. i.e. git and source tree seem to work completely independently and don't share the index.

 

I've been watching this bug for a week or so now. I've experienced it on every repo I work with.

git version is 2.13.3

sourcetree is 2.6 (123)

MacOS Sierra 10.12.6

I've attached screenshots showing SourceTree and git, disagreeing on what is staged.

 

 

!image-2017-07-26-12-28-48-699.png!
fields.summary: Can't stage or unstage files.

fields.description: The selected commit in the main view doesn't have a white circle around the dot anymore.
fields.summary: Selected commit dots/circles don't have a white circle around them anymore

fields.description:
Use 'Kaleidocope' to compare several different branches (tag, origin/branch, local/branch).

e.g. 

I want to compare Tag:1.1 and Tag 2.2 , What's the difference?
fields.summary: Use 'Kaleidocope' to compare several different branches (tag, origin/branch, local/branch)

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
 # Open a Repository in SourceTree for Mac
 # Enter Full Screen mode
 # Attempt to open another repository

In previous versions, this flow would open the second repository in a new tab. With version 2.6, this causes a crash.
fields.summary: SourceTree Crashes When Opening New Tab

fields.description:
I use a commit template which has placeholders for questions that should be answered by each commit message.

The thing is on that template I have bits that are marked as comments by being prefixed by `#` 

When committing with vim those lines are ignored in the final message, but when using SourceTree interface those comments go into the message
fields.summary: Commit message comments are used as part of final commit message

fields.description: Yvette from (Pioneer Recruitment) she is the super user however when we the other users login they have the same view as the super user.
fields.summary: All users have the same View as the super user

fields.description:
Hovering over "TAGS" in the sidebar doesn't show the "Show" text; clicking there does nothing so I'm unable to unfold the list.

I tried creating a tag named `e` using SourceTree and then suddenly the text started to show. But once I unfolded the list (it correctly showed all the tags), right-clicked on `e` and chosen "Delete from all remotes", the list re-folded and I'm back to the original issue.

All of this happens on the [https://github.com/jquery/jquery-wp-content/] repo.
fields.summary: Tags cannot be unfolded

fields.description:
*+Reproduce Step:*
 # Open Repository with fullscreen
 # open other repository by Doubleclick Local Repository list

*+Actual Result:*
 # SourceTree App Crashed

*+Expected Result:*

in my memory,

open repositories with tab on fullscreen mode

 

i've attach crash log
fields.summary: Sourcetree crashed on opening repository when opened repository with fullscreen

fields.description:
I've installed the latest Sourcetree for MacOS - 2.6 (123)

I've changed the theme to the "dark" one.

 

 

When viewing changes in my git repository, the scrollbars are missing the little handle that indicates the scroll position. In the light theme it shows up fine. Attaching a video to demonstrate what i'm seeing.

Note that i'm working with external monitors, not sure whether that matters (i've seen it work correctly once at home, without the external monitors).
fields.summary: Scrollbars missing grab handles in dark theme

fields.summary: Crash when Switching to Dark Mode in Fullscreen

fields.description: !Screen Shot 2017-07-25 at 20.57.40.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Dark theme: popup windows are still light

fields.description:
# Open SourceTree for Mac
 # Use the Maximize button or View -> Enter Full Screen to enter full screen mode.
 # Go to View -> Theme and change your theme (it doesn't matter if you are currently in light or dark theme, just change to the other one.
 # Program will crash with unexpected error.
fields.summary: Crash when changing themes in full screen mode

fields.description: I'm not sure which version number I was on before, but it was the latest one. Moving around between files when I'm trying to see the diffs [both in the history and file status tabs] is sometimes super laggy. Same thing when I'm scrolling through the diff, for some files it takes seconds between when I scroll and when I see movement. Just trying it out now I counted 5s. It's not even a large file, it's 296 lines of Objective-C.
fields.summary: Version 2.6 is much slower than previous version was

fields.description:
When I try to install the command line tools from the SourceTree menu, I get a failure and a message that I need to check the system logs.  There I found this entry:

 

2017-07-25 17:25:08 +0000 (e) Failed to install privileged helper: Error Domain=CFErrorDomainLaunchd Code=4 "(null)"
fields.summary: Cannot install command line tools

fields.description:
Using git flow - I try to close a hotfix.

I get a merge conflict - I then right click and resolve the merge conflict.

Source tree automatically makes a commit (I DONT WANT THIS).

If i try to delete the hotfix branch, sourcetree does not let me because it says the hotfix branch isn't fully merged in yet.

If I click the Commit button in the top right I can see there is still a pre-populated message with the conflicts from the auto commit.

I go ahead and do a blank commit(no files) with this pre-populated message.

I can now finally close the hotfix (without using the 'force' option).
fields.summary: Fix Auto Commit after solving merge conflict

fields.description: Dark theme doesn't work on pop-up windows such as log file, blame file, repository preferences which is blinding.
fields.summary: Dark theme not working in pop-ups

fields.description:
SourceTree mac app seems to crash out if you open a submodule of a repo when the window is in fullscreen mode.

The following info is shown:

fields.description: The new text color for the the commit table when the table itself is inactive/unfocused is white instead of black. This is not standard coloring. The index table colors it correctly. See screenshot.
fields.summary: 2.6: inactive commit text color is non-standard white instead of black

fields.description: Try to authenticate with google SSO within the oauth login. It redirects to the homepage and the popover doesn't dismiss. Can't add the account. Can't do anything.
fields.summary: Sourcetree redirects to the homepage when trying to authenticate OAuth

fields.description: The text color for diff is never black, but some green/red (depending on change type) which reduces contrast and makes for really bad readability
fields.summary: Text color in diff is broken

fields.description:
When trying to connect to remote repositories via Google Authentication, instead of being passed back tot he SourceTree application, I am presented with the Bitbucket dashboard in the small login dialogue box created by SourceTree.

 

Only options available are 'Cancel, which doesn't save any login information, leaving no way to login to BitBucket.
fields.summary: Cannot connect to remote repositories via Google OAuth

fields.description:
Dark theme is a huge win, but there is one small thing which still makes it not usable for me - font color. It is too light as for the dark theme and because of that it is really unpleasant to my eyes, I just can't look on it too long - it literally hurts.

In the screenshots attached there are examples on how this is done in another products (including Atlassian's HipChat)
fields.summary: Dark Theme: make font color darker

fields.description:
When I'm in fullscreen mode, and want to open a new project (e.g. from `Open Recent`) app will crash.

 

Here is [Problem Details and System Configuration|https://pastebin.com/8MAjiQDZ].
fields.summary: Open new project in full screen mode cause app crahs

fields.description:
h3. Description

It's not possible to connect a Bitbucket account to SourceTree, as exiting the window will cause the connection to not be saved. 
h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Click on *Cog icon > Accounts > Connect account*.
 # Follow the steps to log in to Bitbucket. Once you're logged in successfully you'll see the Bitbucket website within this window.
 # There's no way to get out of this window. There's only a *Cancel* button but clicking it will undo the connection to the Bitbucket account, even if the "Stay signed in to this account" box is checked.

Attempting to connect the account from *Preferences > Accounts* also results in the same outcome.
fields.summary: Unable to connect Bitbucket account to SourceTree

fields.description:
It would be ideal for SourceTree to honor (and possibly set) the custom diff and merge tools within a Git repo's local config file.

{{.git/config}}

When our team works on a Unity project, it requires the use of their provided "UnityYAMLMerge" tool, and this is specific to each version of Unity.  As our repos are generally locked off to a version of Unity, it makes much more sense for the diff tools to be set per repo, INSTEAD of globally.

Here is the most concise reference for the desired setup: [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EQB-N-ClO9g]

**
{quote}*On a related note:*
it would also be ideal for the config file to allow external editing to set these settings, allowing our pipeline team to automate setup.  Currently the SourceTree app overwrites the Git global config with it's Diff/Merge settings upon launch.
{quote}
fields.summary: Support local git config for Custom Merge and Diff tools

fields.description:
If I expand the stashes list, and select a stash with the mouse the diff on the right usually reflects the changes in the stash.

But it doesn't update properly if I do the following:
 * Right click on stash 1, select 'Delete Stash', then confirm.
 * At this point I would expect the right hand side panel to clear (or select the next stash down)
 * Then if I select stash 2 (with the mouse), although the stash line updates and goes blue, the right hand side pane still does not update.
 * If I then click on stash 3 it finally does update.
fields.summary: Stash view does not update after dialog and click

fields.description:
After the update, the app crashes when I open a recent file in full view mode.

Before this worked, so I could have my windows in tabs and not separate windows. Now, the app closes unexpectedly.
fields.summary: SourceTree crashes when I "open recent" repository while in full screen mode

fields.description:
It's great that we at last have a dark theme, but it's too blue. For everyday work neutral dark grey is much easier on the eyes. InteliJ with Darkula theme is a great example of dark theme done right - neutral background with warmer font palette.

Besides, your sidebar, some popup menus and table headers are already in neutral grey palette (which I believe caused by Mac graphite theme). Maybe it would be easier to design SourceTree theme around that than figuring out how to change menu colors. I think sidebar colors look better than the rest of UI.
fields.summary: Make dark theme neutral/warmer

fields.description:
After upgrading to latest SourceTree, I can no longer push any commits. Here's the error reported:

 

git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false -c credential.helper=sourcetree push -v --tags origin refs/heads/develop:refs/heads/develop 

Pushing to https://<myAccount>@bitbucket.org/<myPathToRepo>.git

remote: Invalid username or password. If you log in via a third party service you must ensure you have an account password set in your account profile.

fatal: Authentication failed for 'https://<myAccount>@bitbucket.org/<myPathToRepo>.git/'

Completed with errors, see above
fields.summary: Unable to Push my commits to the repo after upgrading to 2.6 (123)

fields.description: When moving the repository browser window close to any side of the screen, it becomes crazy. Attaching the actual proof and visual explanation to this case.
fields.summary: Project repository window is glitching when trying to stick it to the border

fields.description:
SourceTree is near unusable after upgrading to version 2.6.

Every action in the application is very slow and the UI is extremely sluggish.

Activity Monitor shows the app continuously using 100% CPU even as it is completely idle.
fields.summary: SourceTree 2.6 continuously using 100% CPU while idle

fields.description:
Changing system-tabs, selecting branches, selecting commits -- everything works with a lag. Some of these ends up with spinner-ball cursor and minutes-long freezes. It also tends to freeze during startup now.

It makes the app pretty much unusable.
fields.summary: After 2.6 update app is extremely laggy and freezes often

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
 # Go to System Preferences -> Keyboard -> Keyboard Shortcuts and set 'Full Keyboard Access' to 'All controls'.
 # Launch SourceTree and open History View of a repository.
 # Click a row (=commit) -> the row is highlighted.
 # Press Tab key -> 'Sorted by' control gets focus.
 # Press Shift + Tab

Expected behavior: The row selected in step 3 gets focus.

Actual behavior: Crash.

Additional info:
 * No crash if I click the row using mouse at step 5.
fields.summary: Moving focus back to a commit in History View crashes SourceTree

fields.description:
This is going to seem like a triviality (and it is); but I would love it if there was an onscreen option to force delete a branch after I get the "not fully merged; can't delete" error from git.

 !Sample.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Add "Force Delete" Option in the "Deleting Brach..." Error Window

fields.description:
When adding a remote to a repository, I follow these steps:
 # Open the Repository with Sourcetree
 # Open the Repository Settings (Repository -> Repository Settings...)
 # Select the Remotes tab
 # Click the Add Button
 # Click the Globe (Hosted projects) Button

A list of all the Repositories attached to my Github and Bitbucket accounts will be generated.

Every GitHub Repository that is owned by me or a team I am apart of is listed several times (see attachment _redacted.jpg_).

!redacted.jpg|thumbnail!

This bug doesn't apply to starred Repositories (which also appear in this list).
fields.summary: Listing GitHub "Hosted Projects" has many duplicates

fields.description:
With the dark theme, on the Repository Browser, selected items in the list of repos are highlighted with blue and white font . When the you change the focus to another window however, the highlight color becomes grey, but the font color is not changing to black, it remains white which is hard to read against the light gray background.

 

Other listviews in the app do update the color of the font to black. See attached images
fields.summary: Repository Browser: Selected repo not readable with Dark Theme if window not in focus.

fields.description:
This is new in 2.6.

Selecting a commit, will cause sourcetree to deselect and go to another commit.

Annoying as hell.
fields.summary: Very frequently, selecting a commit in the list will not stick

fields.description:
I keep getting this message everytime I need to do any action with remote. 

!Screenshot 2017-07-19 16.46.18.png!
fields.summary: 2.6 version keeps asking me my github password.

fields.description: I've a commit that has two or more branches on it, and that I want to rebase a third branch, nothing happens and I've to manually run "git rebase master". See attached video.
fields.summary: Can't rebase to commit where two branches or more are there already

fields.description:
See video illustrating issue [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RUw83WHJZaY&feature=youtu.be]

 

1 "soft" full screen the app (Option + green Fullscreen button), not true fullscreen - you should be able to see the Mac menubar
2 click on a Local Branch name in BRANCHES area. Simply being on the "History" view is not enough to trigger the bug.
3 choose "Current Branch" from the branches drop-down to restrict the graph view.
4 Command + Tab to a different app, or simply click on a separate ERROR 5 SEE view change to "All Branches"

 

>>> See error where the SourceTree app changes the graph filter back to "All Branches" automatically, undesirably.
fields.summary: App loses chosen filter for History Graph when user switches focus

fields.description:
The application crashes semi-regularly (not 100% of the time) when attemplting to click on a UI element - a checkbox for staging files, the 'Commit' button, etc.  This started on July 10, 2017, but the exact same app was rock solid under daily use prior to that date. There were no system changes in the week prior, all other apps have remained stable.

I've done a clean-reinstall, wiped my preferences, even tried the most recent beta - all seem to crash when a UI element is clicked.
fields.summary: Application Crashes when clicking UI elements (checkboxes, buttons, etc.)

fields.description:
I use OAuth login because SSL certification doesn't work on the latest 2.5.3 version (on my Mac with Sierra).

 

OAuth was working until tonight where I received the "Too many failed authentication attempts. Try again a bit later" error.  Since OAuth was working yesterday, I'm not sure why things changed.

 

Please test 2.5.4 on a Mac using both SSL and OAuth login.  Both are failing on my machine.  2.5.3 worked fine.

 

Thanks,
fields.summary: Failed Login with HTTP OAuth

fields.description: The same shortcut is being used for open and repository browser (see attached screenshot)
fields.summary: Same shortcut for open and show repository browser

fields.description:
In a repository view, I single click on a branch name to view the commits in that branch. Sometimes SourceTree will hesitate; once it hesitated for several minutes, and I thought it had hanged for good. I managed to sample and grab a spindump using OS X’s Activity Monitor, but did not get a screenshot. (I also did not look forward to censoring all our proprietary info from that screenshot.)

When it exhibits this behavior, the commit graph section will draw a varying number of vertical and horizontal gray lines, as if UI widgets were resizing but taking way too long to do so. The vertical lines mostly appear near the right end, where the vertical scroll bar appears. It is not clear what affects the number and position of the lines otherwise. For instance, the horizontal lines do _not_ all fall between rows of the existing commit list.

By clicking back and forth, I can repeat this behavior unreliably, though when it does display the horizontal lines, SourceTree recovers after a second or so.

Using [2.5.3c|https://downloads.atlassian.com/software/sourcetree/SourceTree_2.5.3c.zip], the latest version according to [the SourceTree homepage|https://www.sourcetreeapp.com].
Mac OS X 10.12.5 “Sierra” (16F73)
fields.summary: SourceTree locked up for minutes when I clicked to view (not change to) another branch

fields.description: After clicking "Reset all" button on "reset..." ui, confirmation dialog buttons are showing reversed.
fields.summary: Workspace "Reset All" confirm dialog buttons are reversed

fields.description:
Apparently I have changed my password on our BitBucket server, but had forgotten to update the Keychain password SourceTree uses. I tried to do a Pull and got these results:

git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false -c credential.helper=sourcetree fetch origin 
fatal: Authentication failed for 'URI_REDACTED'
fatal: Authentication failed for 'URI_REDACTED'
fatal: Authentication failed for 'URI_REDACTED'
fatal: Authentication failed for 'URI_REDACTED'
Completed with errors, see above

The value of URI_REDACTED is correct and the same on each line.

SourceTree should not retry a connection after authentication failure, as there’s no way a retry would ever succeed. Besides the “do the right thing” principle, there is also a practical problem with this behavior: the BitBucket server detected multiple failed authentication attempts and locked me out, forcing me to go to the Web site and log in again following the “locked out” method (complete with CAPTCHA).

Software:
SourceTree-Beta Version 2.6 (117)
Mac OS X 10.12.5 “Sierra” (16F73)
fields.summary: SourceTree keeps retrying after authentication failure, with no Cancel button, locking user out
SSH config issues and SSH key request

fields.description: Having the system scroll the position of the files list while the user is attempting to make selection changes, make usage of the system extremely difficult.
fields.summary: The pending files list does not maintain user specified scroll position

fields.summary: Cant' pull/push after updating sourceTree version to 2.5.3(116)

fields.description:
When selecting "Keep staged changes" on the Stash window does not retain the changes.

 

Steps to reproduce:

1. Using a GIT repo, change a file or two. 

2. Click Stash.

3. Provide a Message.

4. Click the 'Keep staged changes" checkmark.

5. Click Ok.

Observe that all files are stashed and none are saved. Expect that all changes must be left in place when you select "Keep staged changes" like it used to.
fields.summary: Stash Keeping Changes Doesn't Keep Changes

fields.description:
The "Show Repository Browser" keyboard shortcut was changed to ⌘O, which has lower priority than, and overridden by the keyboard shortcut for "Open", which is also ⌘O. *This makes it IMPOSSIBLE to open the organizer with the keyboard*. This is an atrocious UX and makes the product feel like it was designed by gremlins. 

PLEASE FIX THIS. It's a small issue that should be an easy fix that is a massive annoyance to anyone who likes to use keyboard shortcuts (AKA 99% of SourceTree's users).
fields.summary: Duplicate keyboard shortcuts for ⌘O
